meanings.definition: The capacity to develop or become something in the future.
meanings.sent1: Her potentialities for growth were evident in her dedication to learning.
meanings.sent2: The teacher saw the potentialities in each student to excel in their own unique way.
meanings.sent3: The potentialities of the seed to grow into a mighty tree amazed the young gardener.
meanings.sent4: The potentialities of the young athlete shone brightly like stars in the night sky.
meanings.sent5: The potentialities of the new technology promised a world of endless possibilities.

meanings.definition: The inherent ability or power to achieve or succeed.
meanings.sent1: His potentialities as a leader were recognized by his peers.
meanings.sent2: The potentialities of the human mind are truly remarkable.
meanings.sent3: The potentialities of the superhero's powers made for an entertaining comic book.
meanings.sent4: The potentialities of the engine to run smoothly were put to the test on the race track.
meanings.sent5: The potentialities of the young artist were evident in every stroke of the brush.

meanings.definition: The range of possible outcomes or options.
meanings.sent1: The potentialities of the decision were carefully considered before making a choice.
meanings.sent2: Exploring the potentialities of the new project opened up exciting opportunities.
meanings.sent3: The potentialities of the game's ending left the players on the edge of their seats.
meanings.sent4: The potentialities of the weather forecast made planning the outdoor event challenging.
meanings.sent5: The potentialities of the market fluctuations required a strategic approach to investments.
